nodes
Class SplitField

java.lang.Object
  nodes.SplitField

public class SplitField
extends java.lang.Object

This class keeps track of where a sensor is placed, so it's easier to find it (if the user clicks on the screen and want to select the closest sensor). To be able to do that easier (instead of using Phytagoras on every sensor and then select the closest), it splits the screen up in smaller blocks. Every time (in this case) 10 sensors is placed in the same block, it splits in four equal sized blocks, and the registrering of sensors goes on. When 10 sensors is detected in one of the new smaller blocks, that one will split in four new blocks, and so on. In that way, when the user clicks somewhere on the screen, only che closests blocks will be searched for the closest sensor.

Author:
Morten Soerensen

Constructor Detail

SplitField

public SplitField(int xMin,
                  int xMax,
                  int yMin,
                  int yMax)
The constructor the this class. When this class is initialized, it will make the integer array and set it's size to 10 (slot 0 to 9).

Parameters:
xMin - the minimum x coordinate
xMax - the maximum x coordinate
yMin - the minimum y coordinate
yMax - the maximum y coordinate

SplitField

private SplitField(SplitField splitMe,
                   int block)
A private constructor for this class. The only time this can be called, is when the window splits.

Parameters:
splitMe - the parent class
block - the block number. This will be used to know, how to calculate the new block's coordinates

selectSensor

public Sensor selectSensor(Location loc,
                           int dist)
This method go through the correct blocks to find the sensor closest to where the user clicked.

Parameters:
loc - the location of where the user clicked (scaled so it fits the window)
dist - the maximal distance from where the sensor is, to where it can be selected
Returns:
the closest sensor (null if none is close enought)

returnSensor

private Sensor returnSensor(Sensor[] list,
                            int length,
                            int dist,
                            Location loc)
This method calculates the distance from the selected sensors, and returns the closest sensor (if the distance is less than max).

Parameters:
list - the array in which it should search
length - the length of the array
dist - the maximal distance from where the sensor is, to where it can be selected
loc - the location of where the user clicked (scaled so it fits the window)
Returns:
the closest sensor or null, if no sensor was within dist

executeCommand

private void executeCommand(Sensor sensor,
                            int flag)
This method is for adding or removing a sensor from the field.

Parameters:
sensor - the sensor in question
flag - the flag used to decide what to do

getBlock

private int getBlock(Sensor sensor)
This method checks which block it should send the sensor to.

Parameters:
sensor - the sensor in question
Returns:
the integer value of the correct block
